intro: Syzygium hemilamprum subsp. hemilamprum, commonly known as the northern satinash, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the tropical rainforests of northern Australia. It typically grows to a height of 5–10 meters, featuring a rounded canopy and smooth, greyish bark. The leaves are elliptical, glossy green on top, and pale underneath, with a leathery texture. It produces small, fragrant white flowers that appear in clusters, followed by edible, red, fleshy berries. This species is well adapted to humid, shaded environments and plays an important ecological role in its native habitat.
